alert.note: Alert for Adams; Billings; Bowman; Divide; Dunn; Golden Valley; Hettinger; McKenzie; Slope; Stark; Williams (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 07 at 3:42AM CDT until September 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR WESTERN NORTH DAKOTA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... .Critical fire weather conditions are expected over western North Dakota this afternoon and evening. Winds will be southerly up to 20 mph and gusting up to 35 mph, with a wind shift to southwesterly late this afternoon. Minimum relative humidity will be in the teens, dropping as low as 11 percent in the far southwest. Any fires that ignite will spread rapidly in dry fuels and become difficult to control or suppress. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN NORTH DAKOTA... The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. * WINDS...South up to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. Winds will shift to southwesterly late in the afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * AFFECTED AREA...Western North Dakota. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite will spread rapidly and become difficult to control or suppress.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Billings; Bowman; Divide; Dunn; Golden Valley; Hettinger; McKenzie; Slope; Stark; Williams
